title: $A sags after weak China data
text:
Fri, Jul 24, 2015, 2:28 PM AEST - Australia Markets close in 1 hr 32 mins $A sags after weak China data AAP â€“ 2 hours 8 minutes ago Recommend Print 
The Australian dollar has sagged following the release of weak China manufacturing data. 
At 1201 AEST on Friday, the currency was trading at 73.09 US cents, down from 73.68 US cents on Thursday. 
The dollar was trading around 73.54 US cents earlier in the session, but dropped sharply after the release of the July flash Caixin/Markit China Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index showed a bigger-than-expected fall to 48.2. 
OANDA Australia and Asia Pacific senior trader Stephen Innes said China was a key factor for the currency's move, adding that "the Aussie is susceptible to a further breakout on the down side". 
"(It's) tough to come up was a good argument to go long (on the) Aussie with weak growth prospects in China, commodities reeling and the prospects of a Fed (Federal Reserve) Sept lift-off increasing," he said. 
"I expect traders to look for any and all selling opportunities over the short term." 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* 73.09 US cents, from 73.68 US cents on Thursday 
* 90.57 Japanese yen, from 91.36 yen 
* 66.56 euro cents, from 67.39 euro cents 
* 110.77 New Zealand cents, from 110.99 NZ cents 
* 47.l13 British pence, from 47.14 pence 
Government bond yields: 
* CGS 5.5pct Jan 2018, 1.849%, from 1.915% on Thursday 
* CGS 4.25pct April 2026, 2.882%, from 2.935% 
* Sept 2015 10-year bond futures contract, at 97.155 (yield 2.845 pct), up from 97.105 (2.895 pct) 
* Sept 2015 3-year bond futures contract, at 98.100 (1.900 pct), up from 98.030 (1.970 per cent) 
(*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session, bond market closes taken at 1630 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
